[[S:SINDRI:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s030_050_sin:50-2250]]__
The Huldra Brothers, back in action again!__

Oh, I can’t wait to get started.__

[[S:::4062-7309]]__

[[S:BROK:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s030_070_brk:0-2550]]__

[[S:SINDRI:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s030_080_sin:320-4750]]__

*109640*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s035_010_son:100-840]]__
Konùnsgard…__

*109642*__

with the chained up Dragon outside.__

[[S:KRATOS:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s035_020_kra:90-1000]]__
And fierce enemies.__
*109644*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s035_030_son:40-3576]]__
Yeah… probably wouldn’t hurt to make sure we’re prepared before going back.__
*109645*__
[[S:KRATOS:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s035_040_kra:19-2189]]__
It is good to see you learning, Atreus.__
*109646*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s035_050_son:48-2684]]__
I’m glad Brok and Sindri were able to work out their differences.__
*109647*__
[[S:KRATOS:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s035_060_kra:29-2304]]__
Now they are twice as irritating.__
*109648*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s035_070_son:0-400]]__
Aw…__
*109649*__
[[S:::750-2690]]__
I think it’s nice to see them trust each other again.__
*109650*__
[[S:SINDRI:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s040_010_sin:70-2500]]__
Greetings! And welcome to Konùnsgard.__
*109651*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s040_020_son:20-1307]]__
What is this place?__
*109652*__
[[S:SINDRI:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s040_030_sin:90-5240]]__
This land was once ruled over by Mótsognir, the infamous Dwarven King.__
*109653*__
[[S:::5960-7900]]__
His Stronghold still stands,__
*109654*__
[[S:::8300-9720]]__
but good luck getting in;__
*109655*__
[[S:::10250-13710]]__
there’s all kinds of nasty beasties between here and there.__
*109656*__
[[S:::14380-16140]]__
That, and the front entrance is locked.__
*109657*__
[[S:::16660-18540]]__
Don’t ask me about the third Entry Stone.__
*109658*__
[[S:::19220-20235]]__
I don’t want to talk about it.__
*109659*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s040_040_son:70-1000]]__
Oookayyy….__
*109660*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s040_050_son:30-1680]]__
We could only find two Entry Stones.__
*109661*__
[[S:::2170-3200]]__
Do you know where the third one?__
*109662*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s040_050_son_a:45-2966]]__
We could only find two Entry Stones. Do you know where the third—__
*109663*__
[[S:SINDRI:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s040_060_sin:50-1250]]__
I told you not to ask!__
*109664*__
[[S:KRATOS:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s040_070_kra:59-2434]]__
(growls) You will tell us where the stone is.__
*109665*__
[[S:SINDRI:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s040_080_sin:50-1100]]__
I CAN’T, okay?__
*109666*__
[[S:::1620-2560]]__
I LOST it.__
*109667*__
[[S:::3170-3902]]__
Are you happy now?__
*109668*__
[[S:KRATOS:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s040_090_kra:30-600]]__
No.__
*109669*__
[[S:SINDRI:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s040_100_sin:190-1450]]__
Check back in with me later.__
*109670*__
[[S:::1930-2750]]__
Maybe it will turn up?__
*109671*__
[[S:SINDRI:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s040_110_sin:236-3400]]__
I just want to make sure you’re good and prepared before heading in any further.__
*109672*__
[[S:::3910-8353]]__
There’s all manner of nastiness left over from the Mad Dwarf King’s foul practices.__
*109673*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s040_120_son:31-1410]]__
What kind of practices?__
*109674*__
[[S:SINDRI:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s040_130_sin:80-700]]__
Oh…__
*109675*__
[[S:::960-1847]]__
various…__
*109676*__
[[S:::2470-6643]]__
sacrificing, dark enchantments, blood magic and so forth…__
*109677*__
[[S:::6958-9547]]__
quite common among the older Dwarves, unfortunately.__
*109678*__
[[S:::10460-11750]]__
Old habits are hard to break.__
*109679*__
[[S:SINDRI:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s045_010_sin:18-4444]]__
Hopefully you’ll find some clues about the three legendary ingredients inside this Stronghold.__
*109680*__
[[S:SINDRI:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s045_020_sin:40-2000]]__
Not a very welcoming place, is it?__
*109681*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s050_010_son:31-1831]]__
That’s an impressive front door.__
*109682*__
[[S:KRATOS:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s050_020_kra:30-1460]]__
The enemies are strong here.__
*109683*__
[[S:::1930-2910]]__
Keep your guard up.__
*109684*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s050_030_son:110-2760]]__
This is the same Dwarf King who built the fortress in Veithurgard,__
*109685*__
[[S:::3170-3670]]__
right?__
*109686*__
[[S:::4360-5375]]__
Chained dragons,__
*109687*__
[[S:::5950-6650]]__
caged trolls…__
*109688*__
[[S:::7750-8910]]__
This Dwarf had weird taste.__
*109689*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s055_010_son:0-1500]]__
Looks like it needs three entry stones.__
*109690*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s055_020_son:40-3050]]__
Still won’t open? Looks like we need three…__
*109691*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s060_010_son:30-530]]__
Well,__
*109692*__
[[S:::920-1950]]__
that’s one entry stone.__
*109693*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s060_020_son:50-1950]]__
This place is even bigger than Veithurgard.__
*109694*__
[[S:KRATOS:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s060_030_kra:0-620]]__
Yes.__
*109695*__
[[S:::1100-3000]]__
The Dwarf King’s reach appears vast.__
*109696*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s060_040_son:40-1140]]__
Wonder what happened to him.__
*109697*__
[[S:MIMIRS HEAD:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s060_050_mmr:20-3150]]__
’Tis a great mystery, even amongst the Sons of Ivaldi.__
*109698*__
[[S:::3630-7390]]__
Mótsognir’s behavior before his disappearance grew increasingly erratic.__
*109699*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s060_060_son:32-556]]__
Why?__
*109700*__
[[S:MIMIRS HEAD:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s060_070_mmr:20-3880]]__
The Dvegræðikr. The very armor you find yourselves searching for.__
*109701*__
[[S:::4430-5760]]__
Though he found two,__
*109702*__
[[S:::6330-9200]]__
I’d wager his failure to find the third ingredient drove him to madness.__
*109703*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s065_010_son:0-750]]__
Stone number two.__
*109704*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s065_020_son:38-609]]__
Mimir,__
*109705*__
[[S:::1410-3280]]__
why did the Dwarf King want this armor so badly?__
*109706*__
[[S:::4110-5150]]__
What’s so special about it?__
*109707*__
[[S:MIMIRS HEAD:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s065_030_mmr:0-2130]]__
There are many legends behind the Dvegræðikr.__
*109708*__
[[S:::2570-4450]]__
A suspicious amount of legends,__
*109709*__
[[S:::4450-7850]]__
which makes confirming anything about this particular armor difficult.__
*109710*__
[[S:::8330-13440]]__
But the one constant among them is the ability of the armor to offer ultimate protection.__
*109711*__
[[S:::13830-16420]]__
A useful attribute for an unpopular King, you see.__
*109712*__
[[S:KRATOS:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s065_040_kra:0-2890]]__
Yet this plagued land is all that remains of him.__
*109713*__
[[S:::3660-5750]]__
This is why you do not trust legends, boy.__
*109714*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s065_050_son:30-530]]__
Well__
*109715*__
[[S:::1330-2250]]__
what can you trust?__
*109716*__
[[S:KRATOS:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s065_060_kra:0-2870]]__
Yourself. Your eyes. Your instincts.__
*109717*__
[[S:::3580-7670]]__
Blind trust in a legend is a gamble. And rarely does it pay off.__
*109718*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s065_070_son:50-750]]__
If you say so.__
*109719*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s070_010_son:47-3028]]__

*109720*__
[[S:KRATOS:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s070_020_kra:20-3250]]__
This “legendary” armor better be worth the trouble.__
*109721*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s070_030_son:41-3527]]__
But if Brok and Sindri are making it together, I’m sure it’s worth the effort.__
*109722*__
[[S:::4984-6211]]__
Don’t you trust them, at least?__
*109723*__
[[S:KRATOS:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s070_040_kra:60-3000]]__
I trust you, Atreus. I do not trust the legend.__
*109724*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s070_050_son:45-567]]__
Oh.__
*109725*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s075_010_son:66-627]]__
We’re In!__
*109726*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s075_020_son:130-650]]__
Okay,__
*109727*__
[[S:::1320-20000]]__
here we go!__
*109728*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s075_030_son:52-2235]]__
Huh… it’s kinda run down in here.__
*109729*__
[[S:KRATOS:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s075_040_kra:0-1180]]__
What did you expect?__
*109730*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s075_050_son:0-550]]__
I dunno…__
*109731*__
[[S:::1590-2610]]__
Less ruin, I guess?__
*109732*__
[[S:::3720-5210]]__
Maybe the Throne Room’s in better shape.__
*109733*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s080_010_son:13-813]]__
Do you hear that?__
*109734*__
[[S:KRATOS:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s080_020_kra:0-530]]__
No.__
*109735*__
[[S:::1060-1750]]__
What do you hear, boy?__
*109736*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s080_030_son:80-680]]__
Crying…__
*109737*__
[[S:::1750-2580]]__
and screams.__
*109738*__
[[S:::4450-5500]]__
A large crowd of people.__
*109739*__
[[S:MIMIRS HEAD:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s080_040_mmr:0-2080]]__
Errr… just old spirits, I suppose.__
*109740*__
[[S:::2440-5400]]__
Leftover victims of the Mad Dwarf’s reign. Still…__
*109741*__
[[S:::5990-7250]]__
that’s rather ominous.__
*109742*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s085_010_son:70-930]]__
They’re getting louder.__
*109743*__
[[S:::1850-2750]]__
They sound almost like…__
*109744*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s085_020_son:104-970]]__
Hel-Walkers!__
*109745*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s085_030_son:20-910]]__
Whoof…__
*109746*__
[[S:::2190-3500]]__
that was a lot of Hel-Walkers.__
*109747*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s085_040_son:0-1190]]__
Hey, look at this.__
*109748*__
[[S:::1540-2250]]__
A blood trail…__
*109749*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s095_010_son:0-1000]]__
His last words…__
*109750*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s105_010_son:80-1180]]__
The things you pulled from him…__
*109751*__
[[S:::2140-4920]]__
those must be the three mythical ingredients Brok was talking about.__
*109752*__
[[S:MIMIRS HEAD:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s105_020_mmr:290-5250]]__
I can say with utmost certainty that I’ve never laid eye on a stranger set of objects in my life.__
*109753*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s105_030_son:50-2310]]__
How are Brok and Sindri supposed to build with…__
*109754*__
[[S:::3480-4250]]__
whatever they are?__
*109755*__
[[S:MIMIRS HEAD:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s105_040_mmr:28-3687]]__
Don’t count the Dwarves out, lad. They’re right pricks, but they’re resourceful.__
*109756*__
[[S:::4159-8534]]__
They once made an unbreakable chain out of little more than a cat’s footstep and bird spit!__
*109757*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s105_050_son:47-1635]]__
That doesn’t even make sense!__
*109758*__
[[S:MIMIRS HEAD:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s105_060_mmr:24-3896]]__
Well, that’s the legend. If you wanted sense, you shouldn’t be talking to a severed head!__
*109759*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s110_010_son:0-1570]]__
Those Hel-Walkers back in the throne room…__
*109760*__
[[S:::2490-4300]]__
They were all the Dwarf King’s people, weren’t they?__
*109761*__
[[S:MIMIRS HEAD:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s110_020_mmr:130-750]]__
Aye, lad.__
*109762*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s110_030_son:0-1180]]__
He killed his own people?__
*109763*__
[[S:MIMIRS HEAD:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s110_040_mmr:60-1110]]__

*109764*__
[[S:::1770-4270]]__
I knew ol’ Mótsognir was a bit cracked, but…__
*109765*__
[[S:::4850-6000]]__
that was rather extreme.__
*109766*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s115_010_son:60-2000]]__
I wonder what this place looked like in better times.__
*109767*__
[[S:MIMIRS HEAD:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s115_020_mmr:40-2540]]__
Konùnsgard was a beautiful land in its heyday.__
*109768*__
[[S:::3150-5690]]__
Before the Dwarf King’s obsession poisoned his mind.__
*109769*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s115_030_son:0-1250]]__
How could he let that happen?__
*109770*__
[[S:KRATOS:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s115_040_kra:0-4480]]__
The Dwarf blindly trusted in the legend—and pursued it without thought to the consequences.__
*109771*__
[[S:::5230-6500]]__
This is the result.__
*109772*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s115_050_son:30-1060]]__
“Trust is a gamble,”__
*109773*__
[[S:::1430-2110]]__
like you said.__
*109774*__
[[S:::2810-3750]]__
And the Dwarf King lost.__
*109775*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s120_010_son:60-760]]__
We made it.__
*109776*__
[[S:::1320-1900]]__
Finally.__
*109777*__
[[S:SINDRI:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s120_020_sin:60-1670]]__
You found the legendary materials?!__
*109778*__
[[S:::2480-3220]]__
Incredible!__
*109779*__
[[S:::3710-5268]]__
Oh, this is so exciting!__
*109780*__
[[S:::5417-7827]]__
Meet me back at the temple and we’ll get started right away!__
*109781*__
[[S:BROK:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s125_010_brk:140-1941]]__
You boys look right beamin’.__
*109782*__
[[S:::2135-4024]]__
Well… the squirt does.__
*109783*__
[[S:::4184-7612]]__
Can’t see squat behind that furzelfuzz you call a beard.__
*109784*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s130_010_son:25-1438]]__
We found the materials!__
*109785*__
[[S:::2559-3775]]__
But they’re so weird…__
*109786*__
[[S:::4470-8218]]__
How do you build a piece of armor out of something so… so…__
*109787*__
[[S:BROK:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s130_020_brk:46-720]]__
Nunya?__
*109788*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s130_030_son:21-691]]__
Nunya?__
*109789*__
[[S:BROK:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s130_040_brk:30-1470]]__
None ’ya fuckin’ business.__
*109790*__
[[S:::1960-4250]]__
Trade secret. We got our ways…__
*109791*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s130_050_son:23-726]]__
Oh…__
*109792*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s135_010_son:44-1059]]__
Whoa…__
*109793*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s135_020_son:160-4790]]__
Look, a dragon! But it’s chained… Is it a pet?__
*109794*__
[[S:KRATOS:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s135_030_kra:0-1500]]__
Do not get any ideas.__
*109795*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s135_040_son:8-1707]]__
Look, it’s another dragon.__
*109796*__
[[S:KRATOS:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s135_050_kra:10-1117]]__
I see it, boy.__
*109797*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s135_060_son:40-580]]__
Chained…__
*109798*__
[[S:::1530-3140]]__
I hope we can find the Binding Shrines.__
*109799*__
[[S:::4040-5250]]__
This place is huge!__
*109800*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s135_070_son:52-1188]]__
Look, a dragon!__
*109801*__
[[S:KRATOS:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s135_080_kra:10-1117]]__
I see it, boy.__
*109802*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s140_010_son:70-2290]]__
If the Dwarf King captured more than one dragon,__
*109803*__
[[S:::3150-5250]]__
he must’ve needed them to create this legendary armor…__
*109804*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s140_020_son:0-2190]]__
This must be how the Dwarf King captured Dragon’s Fury—__
*109805*__
[[S:::3060-4000]]__
by chaining up the dragons.__
*109806*__
[[S:MIMIRS HEAD:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s140_030_mmr:60-2730]]__
Interesting thought, lad. And it makes sense…__
*109807*__
[[S:::3150-6340]]__
Nearly everything about dragons is useful, and contains power.__
*109808*__
[[S:::6770-9000]]__
Teeth, scales… even excrement.__
*109809*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s140_040_son:38-750]]__
Excrement?__
*109810*__
[[S:MIMIRS HEAD:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s140_050_mmr:25-1386]]__
Ah, uh… shit.__
*109811*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s140_060_son:0-1500]]__
Dragon shit is powerful?__
*109812*__
[[S:MIMIRS HEAD:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s140_070_mmr:960-2750]]__
Aye lad. Potently powerful.__
*109813*__
[[S:KRATOS:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s140_080_kra:670-2070]]__
The Head is having fun with you.__
*109814*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s140_090_son:34-1151]]__
Oh. I knew that!__
*109815*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s140_100_son:32-2332]]__
I can’t believe that chain is the only thing holding him down.__
*109816*__
[[S:MIMIRS HEAD:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s140_110_mmr:0-2640]]__
Odds are there’s a bit of magic at play here as well.__
*109817*__
[[S:::3000-5250]]__
This is a Dwarven stronghold, after all.__
*109818*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s142_010_son:0-510]]__
There he is.__
*109819*__
[[S:::1330-1830]]__
Or…__
*109820*__
[[S:::2300-2970]]__
she is?__
*109821*__
[[S:::3720-5000]]__
Are these boy or girl dragons?__
*109822*__
[[S:KRATOS:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s142_020_kra:7-1176]]__
I do not know.__
*109823*__
[[S:MIMIRS HEAD:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s142_030_mmr:30-2950]]__
There are a few ways to find out… but, they’re rather messy.__
*109824*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s142_040_son:34-2547]]__
Er… I guess it doesn’t matter.__
*109825*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_xplhttk_s145_010_son:60-880]]__

*120564*__
[[S:SON:vo_glo_sindri_alone_again_010_son:77-5065]]__

*120567*__
[[S:SON:vo_glo_sindri_alone_again_030_son:126-1435]]__

[[S:SINDRI:vo_glo_sindri_alone_again_040_sin:1023-4840]]__

*120574*__
[[S:KRATOS:vo_glo_sindri_thor_sons_kra:0-2000]]__

[[S:SINDRI:vo_glo_sindri_thor_sons_sin:0-1520]]__

*120576*__
[[S:::2000-4730]]__

*120577*__

[[S:KRATOS:vo_glo_sindri_alfheim_010_kra:30-2160]]__

*120583*__

*120588*__

*122236*__
[[S:::1260-2820]]__
like not being able to leave Midgard.__
*122237*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_OdnLore3_secbrk10_010_mmr:40-2492]]__
Worse still, he robbed her of her warrior spirit.__
*122238*__
[[S:::2919-6061]]__
Freya cannot fight—even to defend herself.__
*122239*__
[[S:::6364-10254]]__
No living thing may she harm, by blade nor spell.__
*122240*__
[[S:::10690-14613]]__
In a world this belligerent, what choice does she have but isolation?__
*122241*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_OdnLore3_secbrk10_010_mmr_d:180-4000]]__
In a world this belligerent, what choice does she have but isolation?__
*122242*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_OdnLore3_secbrk10_010_mmr_a:40-2380]]__
Worse still, he robbed her of her warrior spirit.__
*122243*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_OdnLore3_secbrk10_010_mmr_c:250-3970]]__
No living thing may she harm, by blade nor spell.__
*122244*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_OdnLore3_secbrk10_010_mmr_b:280-3320]]__
Freya cannot fight—even to defend herself.__
*122245*__
[[S:SON:vo_glo_boatlore_OdnLore3_secbrk11_010_son:0-810]]__
Poor Freya…__
*122246*__
[[S:::1840-2810]]__
I guess if I was her,__
*122247*__
[[S:::3390-4586]]__
I’d spit in your face too.__
*122248*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_OdnLore3_secbrk12_010_mmr:60-850]]__
Aye, lad.__
*122249*__
[[S:::1650-2250]]__
So would I.__
*122250*__
[[S:SON:vo_glo_boatlore_TyrOdin_sec1_cus_res_010_son:0-550]]__
So…__
*122251*__
[[S:::1010-3000]]__
why was Týr helping Odin meet with the Giant Kings?__
*122252*__
[[S:SON:vo_glo_boatlore_TyrOdin_sec2_cus_res_010_son:44-2232]]__
So what happened when Týr brought Odin to Jötunheim?__
*122253*__
[[S:SON:vo_glo_boatlore_TyrOdin_sec3_cus_res_010_son:60-2250]]__
So what happened after Odin was cast out of Jötunheim?__
*122254*__
[[S:SON:vo_glo_boatlore_TyrOdin_secbrk00_010_son:0-500]]__
Mimir…__
*122255*__
[[S:::1490-4500]]__
why did you say Týr felt responsible for what Odin did to the Giants?__
*122256*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_TyrOdin_secbrk01_010_mmr:400-3290]]__
There was an incident, shortly after the forging of Mjölnir,__
*122257*__
[[S:::3650-7000]]__
when Týr arranged a diplomatic meeting between Odin and the Giant Kings.__
*122258*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_TyrOdin_secbrk02_010_mmr:170-3759]]__
This was when the Long War was young, when victory was still a thing dreamed of,__
*122259*__
[[S:::3759-7000]]__
and the Jötnar might have tipped the balance between Aesir and Vanir.__
*122260*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_TyrOdin_secbrk03_010_mmr:0-3265]]__
Odin had persuaded Týr that the hammer was merely a deterrent—__
*122261*__
[[S:::3391-5750]]__
a means to broker peace from a position of strength.__
*122262*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_TyrOdin_secbrk04_010_mmr:60-4000]]__
Týr was hopeful to convince all parties they would prosper best through peace.__
*122263*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_TyrOdin_secbrk05_010_mmr:0-2420]]__
He knew the Giants were deeply concerned about the hammer,__
*122264*__
[[S:::2830-5340]]__
a super-weapon in hands they did not trust.__
*122265*__
[[S:::5880-7220]]__
But they trusted Týr.__
*122266*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_TyrOdin_secbrk06_010_mmr:0-5130]]__
Týr always believed the best in people—and taking Odin at his word in his desire for peace,__
*122267*__
[[S:::5520-7250]]__
he brought the Raven King to Jötunheim.__
*122268*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_TyrOdin_secbrk07_010_mmr:430-2250]]__
From there, things unraveled quickly.__
*122269*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_TyrOdin_secbrk08_010_mmr:0-4050]]__
The Giants anticipated Odin’s trickery, and exposed his true agenda,__
*122270*__
[[S:::4170-6250]]__
to spy and steal their secret wisdom.__
*122271*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_TyrOdin_secbrk09_010_mmr:50-4410]]__
With magics, they expelled Odin from their realm, and cursed him never to return.__
*122272*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_TyrOdin_secbrk10_010_mmr:0-760]]__
Frustrated,__
*122273*__
[[S:::1210-4000]]__
Odin visited his fury upon the Giants of Midgard.__
*122274*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_TyrOdin_secbrk11_010_mmr:220-3656]]__
Thor unleashed Mjölnir’s might upon any Giant he could find.__
*122275*__
[[S:::3836-7250]]__
None could stand against the tide of slaughter that followed.__
*122276*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_TyrOdin_secbrk12_010_mmr:40-3540]]__
And at last it seems, with Týr’s aid, they retreated.__
*122277*__
[[S:::3813-6732]]__
The tower disappeared, no Giants could be found in Midgard,__
*122278*__
[[S:::7236-11152]]__
and no man nor god has set foot in Jötunheim since.__
*122279*__
[[S:SON:vo_glo_boatlore_MagModLore_sec1_cus_res_010_son:60-2250]]__
So what happened after Hrungnir fell down on Thor?__
*122280*__
[[S:SON:vo_glo_boatlore_MagModLore_sec2_cus_res_010_son:0-2620]]__
So what happened after Magni and Modi got Hrungnir off Thor?__
*122281*__
[[S:SON:vo_glo_boatlore_MagModLore_secbrk00_010_son:49-3867]]__
Mimir… you never told us what Magni and Modi had to do with Hrungnir.__
*122282*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_MagModLore_secbrk01_010_mmr:540-1180]]__
Oh, yes.__
*122283*__
[[S:::1650-4790]]__
Well, what happened after Hrungnir fell slain upon Thor,__
*122284*__
[[S:::5040-8450]]__
was that nobody in the court could get the stone body off of him.__
*122285*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_MagModLore_secbrk02_010_mmr:23-3838]]__
Thor was no use at this point—his brain rattled, his breath shallow…__
*122286*__
[[S:::4267-7223]]__
but none of Odin’s men were nearly strong enough to help.__
*122287*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_MagModLore_secbrk03_010_mmr:0-3580]]__
Then enter little Magni and Modi, no taller than shrubs,__
*122288*__
[[S:::4110-6316]]__
and while nobody but myself was looking,__
*122289*__
[[S:::6658-9500]]__
they flipped over Hrungnir’s corpse and freed their father.__
*122290*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_MagModLore_secbrk04_010_mmr:80-3091]]__
Magni, being blonder, got all the credit,__
*122291*__
[[S:::3373-6805]]__
and Modi remained bitter about it, from that day to the end…__
*122292*__
[[S:::7145-8747]]__
which, I don’t need to tell you about.__
*122293*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Goodfellow_sec1_cus_res_010_mmr:40-2490]]__
Where were we then? Oh yes—my career!__
*122294*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Goodfellow_sec2_cus_res_010_mmr:80-940]]__
Where were we then?__
*122295*__
[[S:::1380-2500]]__
Oh yes—my first job!__
*122296*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Goodfellow_sec3_cus_res_010_mmr:90-4750]]__
Let’s see… my first job! Right! Me n’ m’mates, in the employ of a faerie king.__
*122297*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Goodfellow_sec4_cus_res_010_mmr:0-1690]]__
Let’s see… my first job! Right!__
*122298*__
[[S:::2230-6000]]__
Me n’ m’mates had the run of the forest, as long as we kept the faerie king amused.__
*122299*__
[[S:SON:vo_glo_boatlore_Goodfellow_secbrk00_010_son:0-520]]__
Mimir,__
*122300*__
[[S:::1350-3140]]__
why did you work for Odin if he’s so horrible?__
*122301*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Goodfellow_secbrk01_010_mmr:60-2038]]__
It’s my career!__
*122302*__
[[S:::2400-7499]]__
And if you mean to make your career as a counselor to kings, you can’t very well rule out petty maniacs—__
*122303*__
[[S:::7828-9500]]__
available positions are scarce enough!__
*122304*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Goodfellow_secbrk02_010_mmr:30-2662]]__
My first master was a cruel piece of work as well,__
*122305*__
[[S:::2781-5775]]__
but I learned through him the enduring power of wit,__
*122306*__
[[S:::6010-8250]]__
which served me well with kings and gods alike.__
*122307*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Goodfellow_secbrk03_010_mmr:28-5023]]__
I couldn’t have been much older than you when I started—a faerie king’s errand boy, and unofficial jester.__
*122308*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Goodfellow_secbrk04_010_mmr:0-2310]]__
By night, my mates and I had the run of the forest.__
*122309*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Goodfellow_secbrk05_010_mmr:16-3204]]__
Goodfellows, they called us—knavish sprites to the last.__
*122310*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Goodfellow_secbrk06_010_mmr:260-4310]]__
We’d get up to all manner of mischief, making fools of the local mortals—__
*122311*__
[[S:::4730-8500]]__
but as long as our lord was kept amused, we were spared the consequences.__
*122312*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Goodfellow_secbrk07_010_mmr:2180-3640]]__
Then one day, he was not amused,__
*122313*__
[[S:::4460-5960]]__
and I saw fit to move on.__
*122314*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Goodfellow_secbrk08_010_mmr:0-4660]]__
Thankfully the ages and roads travelled since then have turned me from that merry wanderer__
*122315*__
[[S:::5250-8020]]__
into the paragon of virtue you see before you today.__
*122316*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_MmrOnWell_sec1_cus_res_010_mmr:70-970]]__
Where was I?__
*122317*__
[[S:::1570-3250]]__
Coming north, making a new start…__
*122318*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_MmrOnWell_sec2_cus_res_010_mmr:0-3750]]__
Now I believe I was just acquainting Odin with my mystic well of knowledge…__
*122319*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_MmrOnWell_sec3_cus_res_010_mmr:50-550]]__
Aye…__
*122320*__
[[S:SON:vo_glo_boatlore_MmrOnWell_sec3_cus_res_010_son:0-1630]]__
So Odin gouged out his own eye?__
*122321*__
[[S:::2540-3860]]__
’Cause of mushrooms you gave him?__
*122322*__
[[S:SON:vo_glo_boatlore_MmrOnWell_secbrk00_010_son:0-650]]__
Mimir,__
*122323*__
[[S:::1260-2669]]__
how’d you come to be in these lands?__
*122324*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_MmrOnWell_secbrk01_010_mmr:170-5750]]__
Lad, there comes a time in every man’s life when he changes his name and heads north to make a new start.__
*122325*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_MmrOnWell_secbrk02_010_mmr:0-4500]]__
If you live long enough to do this many times over, you might end up as far north as this place.__
*122326*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_MmrOnWell_secbrk03_010_mmr:20-3470]]__
By the time I arrived, I already knew Odin by his reputation—__
*122327*__
[[S:::4010-8679]]__
and so I set to demonstrate my worth by coming to him with something I knew he’d value—__
*122328*__
[[S:::9010-11023]]__
a mystic well of knowledge.__
*122329*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_MmrOnWell_secbrk04_010_mmr:0-5750]]__
Or rather, I should say, a well of water laced with enough mystic mushrooms to make a god see visions.__
*122330*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_MmrOnWell_secbrk05_010_mmr:410-2500]]__
Oh, he was rightly impressed.__
*122331*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_MmrOnWell_secbrk06_010_mmr:35-3685]]__
Can’t say for sure what he saw that led him to try gouging out his own eyes,__
*122332*__
[[S:::4005-6358]]__
but I managed to restrain him before he finished the job.__
*122333*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_MmrOnWell_secbrk07_010_mmr:0-5791]]__
Then I persuaded him it had been his sacrifice, made for an even higher form of sight to be bestowed,__
*122334*__
[[S:::6028-7541]]__
blah-de-blah-de-blah-de-blah.__
*122335*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_MmrOnWell_secbrk08_010_mmr:20-1490]]__
I used to think he never caught on.__
*122336*__
[[S:::2110-5750]]__
But the day he took my eye, I realized he had never been fooled.__
*122337*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_MmrOnWell_secbrk09_010_mmr:20-1418]]__
He knew I’d outwitted him,__
*122338*__
[[S:::1767-5561]]__
called the lesson wisdom, and hired me, to make sure from then on I was on his side.__
*122339*__
[[S:::5938-8378]]__
And for a long, long time, I truly was.__
*122340*__
[[S:::9230-11098]]__
Doesn’t mean he didn’t hold a grudge.__
*122341*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Mmr_Odin_sec1_cus_res_010_mmr:0-2500]]__
I believe we were discussing my youthful ambitions…__
*122342*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Mmr_Odin_sec2_cus_res_010_mmr:0-4000]]__
I believe I was sayin’… The Aesir had power, but lacked for strategy…__
*122343*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Mmr_Odin_sec3_cus_res_010_mmr:80-750]]__
Where was I then?__
*122344*__
[[S:SON:vo_glo_boatlore_Mmr_Odin_sec3_cus_res_020_son:0-2200]]__
You’d become Odin’s most trusted advisor.__
*122345*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Mmr_Odin_sec3_cus_res_030_mmr:0-700]]__
Aye…__
*122346*__
[[S:SON:vo_glo_boatlore_Mmr_Odin_sec4_cus_res_010_son:8-2052]]__
So what did you do to get Odin so mad at you?__
*122347*__
[[S:SON:vo_glo_boatlore_Mmr_Odin_sec5_cus_res_010_son:42-2965]]__
Mimir—you were getting to how Odin turned on you.__
*122348*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Mmr_Odin_sec5_cus_res_020_mmr:0-2000]]__
Well, I felt my duty to Odin had evolved…__
*122349*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Mmr_Odin_sec5_cus_res_020_mmr_a:260-2500]]__
Well, I felt my duty to Odin had evolved…__
*122350*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Mmr_Odin_sec6_cus_res_010_mmr:0-1030]]__
To finish what I was saying—__
*122351*__
[[S:::1500-5750]]__
I tried to serve Odin by serving peace, and he took it as disloyalty.__
*122352*__
[[S:SON:vo_glo_boatlore_Mmr_Odin_secbrk00_010_son:70-733]]__
Mimir,__
*122353*__
[[S:::1100-3600]]__
I still don’t get why you ever wanted to work for Odin.__
*122354*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Mmr_Odin_secbrk01_010_mmr:20-2250]]__
Back then, I was young enough to still be ambitious.__
*122355*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Mmr_Odin_secbrk02_010_mmr:30-3161]]__
The Aesir gods were as powerful a force as I’d come across,__
*122356*__
[[S:::3420-7123]]__
but they clearly lacked for strategy, focus, and sage counsel.__
*122357*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Mmr_Odin_secbrk03_010_mmr:0-2000]]__
All this could I faithfully provide.__
*122358*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Mmr_Odin_secbrk04_010_mmr:60-4267]]__
And so, a stranger from a far-off island found himself with Odin’s ear,__
*122359*__
[[S:::4667-7000]]__
trusted as he trusted no one but himself.__
*122360*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Mmr_Odin_secbrk05_010_mmr:40-2640]]__
And with that kind of power, laddie, I must confess—__
*122361*__
[[S:::3010-3750]]__
there are perks.__
*122362*__
[[S:SON:vo_glo_boatlore_Mmr_Odin_secbrk06_010_son:0-1792]]__
Yeah, but he’s Odin!__
*122363*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Mmr_Odin_secbrk07_010_mmr:30-2510]]__
I never claimed to be perfect, laddie, only clever.__
*122364*__
[[S:::3300-4750]]__
And often too clever by half.__
*122365*__
[[S:SON:vo_glo_boatlore_Mmr_Odin_secbrk08_010_son:26-1993]]__
So what did you to do get Odin so mad at you?__
*122366*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Mmr_Odin_secbrk09_010_mmr:60-560]]__
Well,__
*122367*__
[[S:::940-5290]]__
for a long time, my job was to enable Odin, and I was fucking excellent at it.__
*122368*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Mmr_Odin_secbrk10_010_mmr:0-3390]]__
Gradually, as I grew more to care about… people, and the world,__
*122369*__
[[S:::3960-5500]]__
my job became to contain him.__
*122370*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Mmr_Odin_secbrk11_010_mmr:50-1500]]__
To protect him from himself.__
*122371*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Mmr_Odin_secbrk12_010_mmr:0-3400]]__
By serving peace, I served his interests as well, that’s the truth…__
*122372*__
[[S:::4020-5500]]__
but he saw it as disloyalty.__
*122373*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Mmr_Odin_secbrk13_010_mmr:0-3890]]__
No longer trusting my motives, but not wishing to part with my brain or tongue,__
*122374*__
[[S:::4400-8900]]__
he bound me to a tree and adopted a new pastime of casual torture.__
*122375*__
[[S:SON:vo_glo_boatlore_Mmr_Odin_secbrk14_010_son:25-2692]]__
Well, I’m glad we came along to cut off your head.__
*122376*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Mmr_Odin_secbrk15_010_mmr:50-960]]__
Aye, lad.__
*122377*__
[[S:::1360-2410]]__
Lucky break that was.__
*122378*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Hrimthur_sec1_cus_res_010_mmr:60-4930]]__
What were we into, then? Oh! The revenge plot of Hrimthur, the stone mason’s son.__
*122379*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Hrimthur_sec2_cus_res_010_mmr:130-960]]__
We were at…__
*122380*__
[[S:::1380-5750]]__
the stone mason’s son, plotting revenge, observed the shoddiness of Asgard’s walls.__
*122381*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Hrimthur_sec3_cus_res_010_mmr:190-5000]]__
So then! Hrimthur, the stone mason’s son in disguise, offered to fix Asgard’s walls.__
*122382*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Hrimthur_sec4_cus_res_010_mmr:280-5750]]__
Alright, the stone mason’s son, Hrimthur—he builds Asgard a great wall, and demands his prize.__
*122383*__
[[S:SON:vo_glo_boatlore_Hrimthur_sec5_cus_res_010_son:40-2780]]__
So… Hrimthur just wanted to whisper in Freya’s ear?__
*122384*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Hrimthur_sec5_cus_res_020_mmr:30-1000]]__
Aye…__
*122385*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Hrimthur_sec6_cus_res_010_mmr:80-4800]]__
We’d come to the part where Thor caught up with Hrimthur, and slew the stone mason’s son.__
*122386*__
[[S:SON:vo_glo_boatlore_Hrimthur_sec7_cus_res_020_son:30-2250]]__
So what did the stone mason’s son whisper to Freya?__
*122387*__
[[S:SON:vo_glo_boatlore_Hrimthur_secbrk00_010_son:30-3420]]__
Mimir, you never told me what happened with the stonemason’s son.__
*122388*__
[[S:::4240-5430]]__
You said he’d have his revenge.__
*122389*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Hrimthur_secbrk01_010_mmr_b:79-3246]]__
I said he’d plot his revenge, and so he did.__
*122390*__
[[S:SON:vo_glo_boatlore_Hrimthur_secbrk00_010_son_b:50-1250]]__
You said he’d have his revenge.__
*122391*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Hrimthur_secbrk01_010_mmr:20-1510]]__
Hrimthur, son of Thamur?__
*122392*__
[[S:::1900-4950]]__
I said he’d plot his revenge, and so he did.__
*122393*__
[[S:SON:vo_glo_boatlore_Hrimthur_secbrk00_010_son_a:0-491]]__
Mimir,__
*122394*__
[[S:::960-3000]]__
you never told me what happened with the stonemason’s son.__
*122395*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Hrimthur_secbrk01_010_mmr_a:30-1500]]__
Hrimthur, son of Thamur?__
*122396*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Hrimthur_secbrk02_010_mmr:50-3968]]__
After completing his father’s masterwork, the Great Wall of Jötunheim,__
*122397*__
[[S:::4240-8617]]__
he thought of nothing but making the Aesir pay for their crimes against the Giants.__
*122398*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Hrimthur_secbrk03_010_mmr:0-4360]]__
Once he longed to fight Thor, but tragedy had brought wisdom to Hrimthur—__
*122399*__
[[S:::4720-5750]]__
and cunning.__
*122400*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Hrimthur_secbrk04_010_mmr:300-4276]]__
He observed that Asgard’s walls were half-built and shoddy,__
*122401*__
[[S:::4464-7500]]__
for no Aesir god could be bothered with such tiresome labor.__
*122402*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Hrimthur_secbrk05_010_mmr:0-4540]]__
So Hrimthur adopted the guise of an ordinary man, and made the Aesir an offer—__
*122403*__
[[S:::5080-7300]]__
he would build them majestic new walls,__
*122404*__
[[S:::7300-9360]]__
and if he couldn’t build them within two turns of the season,__
*122405*__
[[S:::9360-11200]]__
they would owe him nothing for his labors.__
*122406*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Hrimthur_secbrk06_010_mmr:30-1130]]__
And if he succeeded,__
*122407*__
[[S:::1690-4656]]__
he asked only for an audience with the goddess Freya.__
*122408*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Hrimthur_secbrk07_010_mmr:180-4750]]__
Odin agreed, knowing the task was impossible, but intrigued by this stranger.__
*122409*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Hrimthur_secbrk08_010_mmr:0-4120]]__
Hrimthur made short work of it, of course—he had the benefit of his father’s training,__
*122410*__
[[S:::4120-6500]]__
and the aid of a magical stallion for fetching stones.__
*122411*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Hrimthur_secbrk09_010_mmr:100-3739]]__
Odin was not happy to find himself on the losing end of the wager,__
*122412*__
[[S:::4057-6420]]__
but he seemed to uphold his end of the bargain.__
*122413*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Hrimthur_secbrk10_010_mmr:0-1530]]__
Freya was sent to meet the mason,__
*122414*__
[[S:::2030-5000]]__
and to her surprise, he wanted only to whisper something in her ear.__
*122415*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Hrimthur_secbrk11_010_mmr:120-3010]]__
That being done, he made his way out of Asgard…__
*122416*__
[[S:::3870-8314]]__
and when he found Thor awaiting him at the gates of Midgard, he knew he had been double-crossed.__
*122417*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Hrimthur_secbrk12_010_mmr:22-4557]]__
But he didn’t care, because his plan was complete.__
*122418*__
[[S:SON:vo_glo_boatlore_Hrimthur_secbrk13_010_son:60-760]]__
It was?__
*122419*__
[[S:::1630-2607]]__
What did he say to Freya?__
*122420*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Hrimthur_secbrk14_010_mmr:0-3500]]__
Only she could say for certain, but I’ve had many moons to work it out.__
*122421*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Hrimthur_secbrk15_010_mmr:440-4340]]__
Hrimthur knew that Freya loathed the Aesir, despite her marriage to Odin,__
*122422*__
[[S:::4730-7500]]__
and I believe he gave her the secret to Asgard’s defenses.__
*122423*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_Hrimthur_secbrk16_010_mmr:20-3589]]__
Some weakness he may have built in, structural or magical,__
*122424*__
[[S:::3816-9800]]__
which I expect will be exploited come Ragnarök when Surtr arrives to burn Asgard to ash.__
*122425*__
[[S:::10180-11130]]__
If not sooner.__
*122426*__
[[S:SON:vo_glo_boatlore_TriptychsToGo_010_son:0-1350]]__
Got any more Giant stories, Mimir?__
*122427*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_TriptychsToGo_020_mmr:50-2500]]__
Well, if you see any more shrines about, you can always ask.__
*122428*__
[[S:SON:vo_glo_boatlore_WrapOnMimir_010_son:37-1883]]__
Don’t you have any more stories to tell, Mimir?__
*122429*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_glo_boatlore_WrapOnMimir_020_mmr:50-1070]]__
I’m talked out, lad.__
*122430*__
[[S:::1740-4250]]__
But some day I imagine I’ll be telling your story.__
*122431*__
[[S::vo_lvl_pro03_s620_010_son_stem:2945-3609]]__
What was that—?__
*122432*__
[[S::vo_lvl_pro03_s620_010_kra_stem:3820-4553]]__
Your bow..!__
*122433*__
[[S:::26794-28327]]__
Who are you?!__
*122434*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_pro03_s010_010_son:32-4038]]__
We’re finally home… feels like a lifetime ago.__
*122435*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_lvl_pro03_s010_020_mmr:27-4161]]__
Bit drafty maybe, but it’s a right improvement over having tree bark in your tadger.__
*122436*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_pro03_s030_010_son:30-4910]]__
Can’t believe it was next to mother’s garden this whole time! No wonder we could never get in there.__
*122437*__
[[S:KRATOS:vo_lvl_pro03_s030_010_kra:20-1000]]__
Time to rest.__
*122438*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_pro03_s030_020_son:10-1311]]__
I’m gonna sleep through winter!__
*122439*__
[[S:MIMIR:vo_lvl_pro03_s030_030_mmr:60-2080]]__
Okay… this’ll do.__
*122440*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_pro03_s030_040_son:31-935]]__
Aren’t you tired?__
*122441*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_pro03_s030_050_son:0-500]]__
Oh!__
*122442*__
[[S:::810-2100]]__
Have we got more to do out there?__
*122443*__
[[S:KRATOS:vo_lvl_pro03_s040_010_kra:0-500]]__
Sleep.__
*122444*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_pro03_s040_020_son:540-1670]]__
Way ahead of you.__
*122445*__
[[S:KRATOS:vo_lvl_pro03_s050_010_kra:0-1750]]__
Atreus, are you ready?__
*122446*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_pro03_s050_020_son:0-630]]__
Yeah, but…__
*122447*__
[[S:::1330-2560]]__
I had the weirdest dream.__
*122448*__
[[S:::3510-4760]]__
Fimbulwinter was ending.__
*122449*__
[[S:::5490-6640]]__
And Thor came for us,__
*122450*__

*122451*__
[[S:KRATOS:vo_lvl_pro03_s050_030_kra:0-1310]]__

*122452*__
[[S:SON:vo_lvl_pro03_s050_040_son:80-1130]]__
But it felt different.__
*122453*__
[[S:::2340-3230]]__
It felt real…__
*122454*__
[[S:::4070-4720]]__
it felt like__
*122455*__
[[S:::6140-6750]]__
the future.__
*122456*__
[[S:KRATOS:vo_lvl_pro03_s050_050_kra:0-2179]]__
Then we will worry about it tomorrow.__
*122457*__
[[S:::2710-3380]]__
Today,__
*122458*__

*122459*__
[[S:::6590-7090]]__
Come.__
*122460*__
[[S:SON:vo_glo_valkyrie_s005_010_son:0-880]]__
This place.__

It feels like….__
*122462*__

like a prison.__
*122463*__
[[S:MIMIRS HEAD:vo_glo_valkyrie_s005_020_mmr:60-2750]]__

*122465*__
[[S:SON:vo_glo_valkyrie_s005_030_son:55-6086]]__
